articles.title: Asian Stocks Gain at Open After Wall Street Rally: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Asian stocks hit a record high after Wall Street set new peaks, as investors bet on an interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve this week.

articles.title: Appeals court allows Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook to keep her job - The Washington Post
articles.description: The Trump administration had sought to remove Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve Board before a key meeting on setting interest rates.

articles.title: Trump administration orders Delta, Aeromexico to unwind joint venture by Jan. 1 - CNBC
articles.description: Delta Air Lines and Aeromexico would have to end their joint venture by Jan. 1.

articles.title: Microsoft Raises Quarterly Dividend by 9.6% - The Wall Street Journal
With no DOJ breakup, Alphabet becomes a $3 trillion company - TechCrunch
articles.description: Investors continue to reward Alphabet's stock after a judge declined to break up Google earlier this month.

articles.title: Dan Rather Warns Paramount Buying Warner Bros. Discovery “Would Change CNN Forever” - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: We “have to be concerned about the consolidation of huge billionaires getting control of nearly all of the major news outlets,” the former 'CBS Evening News' anchor said.

articles.title: Investors eyeing a Fed rate cut this week: Beware the unintended fallout for U.S. markets and the economy - MarketWatch
articles.description: A Fed cut in 2007 could hold some clues on how things might play out this time around, according to the Leuthold Group

articles.title: Tech Buying Pushes S&P 500, Nasdaq to Fresh Records - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Investors have been emboldened by thawing trade relations, rate-cut expectations

articles.title: What do people actually use ChatGPT for? OpenAI provides some numbers. - Ars Technica
articles.description: New study breaks down what 700 million users do across 2.6 billion daily GPT messages.

articles.title: Nvidia Stock Falls As China Pressures U.S. Chipmakers - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Nvidia stock fell Monday along with shares of other U.S.-based chipmakers as China stepped up political pressure on the U.S.

articles.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Up As Buffett Stock Tests Entry; Tesla Jumps On Musk Move (Live Coverage) - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: The Dow was firm and the Nasdaq gained. Tesla rose on the stock market today after an Elon Musk move. A Warren Buffett stock tested an entry.

articles.title: Once richer than Peter Thiel, Pop Mart’s Wang Ning sees $6 billion vanish with Labubu hype - Fortune
articles.description: Once celebrities start posing with a toy, Gen-Z tunes out. What was scarce and cool suddenly feels commercial and inauthentic.

articles.title: Tesla Stock Turns Positive for 2025 as Elon Musk Buys About $1B of Shares - Investopedia
articles.description: Elon Musk purchased some 2.57 million Tesla shares last week, sending the stock into positive territory for the year.

articles.title: Mortgage Rates Start Week at Another Long-Term Low - Mortgage News Daily
articles.description: Mortgage rates have done almost nothing but move lower over the past 4 months. The first Fridays in August and September account for about half of the total drop thanks to weaker results in the jobs report.  Since the September 5th jobs report, rates have hel…

articles.title: Google says users want summaries over links as it tries to balance 'a healthy ecosystem' amid AI Overview lawsuit - 9to5Google
articles.description: In the midst of a lawsuit over AI Overviews, Google says that user preferences are shifting to want summaries over traditional links.

articles.title: Why Trump wants companies to report earnings less frequently - NPR
articles.description: President Trump would like companies to report their earnings less frequently. Executives have long called for that -- but some financial experts worry it would go badly.

articles.title: Commercial Airplanes Are Dosing Passengers With Neurotoxic Gases - Futurism
articles.description: An increasing number of commercial airline passengers and flight attendants are being exposed to dangerous fumes while in the air.
